page.title: 11Introduction -Caerleon
page.content: Most of our area is agricultural land, but is also contains the historic village of Caerleon. People have lived in the area since prehistoric times. there is still evidence of settlement from many periods of history. There are the remains pf an iron age hill fort, whose rampart and ditches can be clearly seen. The remains of a Norman motte and bailey castle are near the centre of the village. Constant settlement through the centuries is shown by various historic buildings which still survive. The Bull Inn and the Hanbury Arms where Tennyson once stayed, date from the 15th century and another coaching Inn, the Bell, may be even older, while the Drovers Arms was on the old catte drovers road from the Welsh interior to market. Legend has it that Caerleon was King Arthurs Camelot but by far the most
